articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun at 00:00 on Saturday, the 23rd anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un entered the hall where the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il stand.
					
					 The chief of a guard of honor of the Ground, Naval, Air and Anti-Air Forces of the Korean People's Army and the Worker-Peasant Red Guards made a salute towards the statues.
					
					 A floral basket in the name of Kim Jong Un was placed before the statues.
					
					 Also laid before the statues was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Kim Jong Un together with the participants paid high tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 He entered the hall of immortality where Kim Il Sung lies in state.
					
					 He paid deep homage and made bow to Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He entered the hall of immortality where Kim Jong Il lies in state.
					
					 He paid deep homage and made bow to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Accompanying him were officials of the party and armed forces organs and contributors to the successful test-launch of ICBM.

articles.title: Mexican Party Delegation Here
articles.content:
Mexican Party Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Workers' Party of Mexico led by Ricardo Cantu Garza, coordinator of its National Coordinating Committee, arrived here Saturday.

articles.title: State Senior Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
State Senior Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- State senior officials visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Saturday, the 23rd anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's demise, the greatest memorial day of the nation.
					 Among them were Kim Yong Nam, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK; Pak Pong Ju, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and premier of the Cabinet; and other senior officials of the state, the chairperson of a friendly party, members of the party central leadership organs here and officials of the ministries and national institutions.
					
					 Seen at the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il was a floral basket with ribbons bearing the august name of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Laid before the statues was a floral basket in the joint name of the Central Committee and the Central Military Commission of the WPK and the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 Also placed before the statues was a floral basket in the joint name of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the Cabinet of the DPRK.
					
					 The visitors paid tribute to the statues.
					
					 They also paid homage to the great leaders in the halls where they lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls that house cars, an electric car, boat and train coaches used by them for field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.
					
					 On the same day service personnel and people from all walks of life also visited the palace to pay homage to the great leaders.

articles.title: Senior Party, State Officials Visit Korean Revolution Museum
articles.content:
Senior Party, State Officials Visit Korean Revolution Museum
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials visited the Korean Revolution Museum on Saturday, the 23rd anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's demise.
					 Among them were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party, members of the party central leadership organs here and officials of the ministries and national institutions.
					
					 After being briefed on the facts that Kim Il Sung made energetic efforts for the happiness of the people, the prosperity of the country, its reunification and the global cause of independence from the first day of his revolutionary struggle to the last period of his life, and that he did everything possible for the country and nation, the visitors went round several rooms.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Service personnel, people from all walks of life and school youth and children in the DPRK visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to pay tribute to them on the 23rd anniversary of the demise of the President.
					Seen before the statues of the great leaders on Mansu Hill was a floral basket from respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					Placed at the statues were floral baskets, together with bouquets, in the names of party, armed forces and power bodies, social organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, institutions, industrial establishments and schools in the city.
					
					Also laid there was a floral basket in the name of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front.
					
					The visitors paid high tribute to the statues of the great leaders.
					
					Floral baskets in the names of KPA units, institutions and enterprises and bouquets and flowers were placed before the statues of the great leaders at Kim Il Sung University, the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, the Ministry of People's Security, the Mansudae Art Studio and other parts of Pyongyang.
					
					Meanwhile, servicepersons, working people and school youth and children across the country visited the statues of the great leaders and their smiling portraits in their residential areas.

articles.title: Great Life of Devotion for People
articles.content:
Great Life of Devotion for People
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of the anniversary of the demise of President Kim Il Sung (July 8), the yearning for the peerlessly great man, who devoted his all to the happiness of people, grows stronger among the Korean people.
					 After embarking on the road of revolution in his early years, he regarded the slogan "Go among the people!" as his lifelong creed and always found himself among the people to frankly discuss state and family affairs.
					
					 One day in June Juche 49 (1960), he visited the Onchon Tideland in the western coastal area of the DPRK, stepped into the tideland and unfolded a grand plan to turn it into a vast cropland conducive to improving the people's diet. 
					
					 For the happiness and wellbeing of people, he did not hesitate to walk into a pit to meet miners or take a ferryboat to visit a farm village.
					
					 The number of units he gave field guidance in his lifetime reached more than 20,600.
					
					 Indeed, his life was the one of the fatherly leader of people, the one of great devotion for people which abides long in the memory of the Korean people.

articles.title: First Secretary of Russian Youth League Lays Floral Basket before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
First Secretary of Russian Youth League Lays Floral Basket before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Vladimir Isakov, first secretary of the C.C., the Lenin Young Communist League who is secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of the Russian Federation and is heading a delegation of the league, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Saturday, the 23rd anniversary of the President's demise. 
					 He laid a floral basket before the statues of the great leaders and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Russian Youth League Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Russian Youth League Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Lenin Young Communist League of the Russian Federation led by Vladimir Isakov, first secretary of the C.C., the league who is secretary of the C.C., Communist Party of the Russian Federation, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The members of the delegation visited the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum which houses historic data and relics showing the revolutionary activities of the President and his family members. 
					
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary career of the President and patriotic life of his family members at the old home, they went round the historic relics.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Korean Revolution Museum, Youth Movement Museum, Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, Natural History Museum, Central Zoo and other places.

articles.title: Papers Praise Kim Il Sung as Peerless Patriot and Eternal Father of Nation
articles.content:
New Historical Relics Registered in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Seven historical relics were newly registered in DPRK this year.
					 They are sites for salt production in the area of Wonup workers' district in Onchon County of Nampho City, and Wondong Dolmen in Township of Yonsan County and Taechon Dolmen in Rinsan County of North Hwanghae Province and four other dolmens.
					
					 It was confirmed that sites for salt production were used by people of Josonhuguk (first century-second century).
					
					 The dolmens are typical remains representing the times of Tangun Korea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Kim Il Sung's Feats for Global Independence
articles.content:
Papers Praise Kim Il Sung as Peerless Patriot and Eternal Father of Nation
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of the DPRK Saturday editorially mark the 23rd anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They praise Kim Il Sung as the sun of Juche, peerless patriot and eternal father of the nation who performed immortal exploits for the country, people, era and revolution with his unique idea and theory and great revolutionary practices.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun says:
					
					 There are many famous statesmen and great men in the world, but the world does not know such prominent leader and great revolutionary as the President who devoted his all to the struggle for independence of popular masses and laid strong foundation for the prosperity of the country and the nation in his lifetime.
					
					 The revolutionary idea of the President is the perfect guiding idea of the revolution in which the man-centered philosophical idea, popular masses-centered theory of revolution and guiding methods constitute an integral system.
					
					 The principle of giving priority to self-development of our people is based on the revolutionary idea of the President that the revolution of one's own country should be made by one's own efforts.
					
					 In the whole period of the leadership of the revolution, the President did all he could, foreseeing the distant future of the country.
					
					 Thanks to the noble and patriotic life of the President, today our country is displaying its might as an invincible politico-ideological power, matchless military power and promising youth power.
					
					 All the treasures the President left as legacies serve as the foundation guaranteeing the dignity and prosperity of all the generations of the nation.
					
					 Minju Joson calls upon all the people to unite close around respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un and work hard to successfully carry out the wish of the President for building a socialist power.

articles.title: Minju Joson Warns S. Korean Authorities Not to Persist in Reckless Moves
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Kim Il Sung's Feats for Global Independence
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- The feats performed by President Kim Il Sung for the cause of global independence under the banner of anti-imperialist struggle in the 20th century are kept in the minds of the progressive mankind forever, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article.
					 Kim Il Sung is the great master of idea and theory who provided the immortal ideo-theoretical guidelines for accomplishing the human cause of independence, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 He fathered the immortal Juche idea, showing the way for carving out the independent destiny of human being for the first time in history and ushering in the era of independence, an era of gigantic changes.
					
					 The anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle led by him was a national liberation war in the colony which was guided to victory by the Juche idea and the Songun idea based on it. It indicated the most correct way for the oppressed peoples to retake their national sovereignty and achieve the independence of their countries.
					
					 He had consistently embodied the Juche idea, the Songun idea into the whole course of the revolutionary struggle and built a socialist fortress of socialism shining with independence in politics, self-support in the economy and self-reliance in defense on this land.
					
					 He set independence, peace and friendship as a consistent tenet of the DPRK's foreign policy and developed the relations of good-neighborliness, friendship and cooperation with those countries which respect the sovereignty of the DPRK and are friendly toward it.
					
					 Thanks to the precious legacy provided by him for the human cause of independence, the cause of global independence is making a triumphant advance despite all sorts of challenge and tempests of history.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Make Switchover in Its DPRK Policy e070827 - U.S., S. Korea Stage Anti-DPRK Bombing Drill
articles.content:
Minju Joson Warns S. Korean Authorities Not to Persist in Reckless Moves
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Minju Joson Saturday in a commentary hits at the south Korean authorities' reckless moves over the DPRK's successful test-fire of ICBM.
					 The chief executive of south Korean called a "national security council" meeting at which he clamored about "irresponsible provocation" and "strong condemnation." He went the lengths of calling for south Korea-U.S. combined ballistic missile firing drill with the approval of Trump, asserting "it is not a situation to be tackled with a statement only."
					
					 Those related to the foreign affairs and security and riff-raffs of the ruling and opposition parties vied with each other to talk about "violation" and "consultation of measures with the international community". The puppet military gangsters let out such malignant vituperation as "provocation" and "destruction," impudently hurting the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership.
					
					 Such disgusting behaviors of the south Korean authorities remind one of a mad dog barking at the moon, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 Now that the U.S. makes desperate efforts to drive the Korean nation into a nuclear disaster, it is quite natural for the DPRK to harden the shield of justice and sharpen the nuclear sword of peace for defending the destiny of the nation, the supreme interests of the country and the global peace and security and there will be no reason and cause for anyone to fault the just measure of the DPRK for self-defence.
					
					 Gone are the days never to return when the puppet forces could run wild, counting on the U.S.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should be clearly mindful that their rash actions of hurting the dignity of the DPRK and its social system would invite only the condemnation and punishment by the entire nation, and should halt all reckless moves for which they would feel awfully sorry.

articles.title: New Materials Proving Sexual Slavery Enforced by Japan Disclosed
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Urges U.S. to Make Switchover in Its DPRK Policy
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Heard from former dignitaries and experts in the Korean issue of various countries of the world are strong demand for the U.S. to make a switchover in its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 Calls from within the U.S., in particular, urge the Trump administration to make a bold switchover in the policy, facing up to the situation in which the structure of forces have undergone a change between the DPRK and the U.S.
					
					 Eric Gomez, senior fellow at the Cato Institute in the U.S., said the U.S. policy toward the DPRK is a total failure, urging the Trump administration to go back to the drawing board to reshape it. He also commented that the "maximum pressure" policy may easily be accepted by Americans at present but it is the one of rare possibility in leading north Korea into a change.
					
					 A former policy researcher under the Bush administration, Benette Ramberg, in his commentary said the U.S. and south Korea have to admit the status quo of the nuclear issue of north Korea, stressing that it is a pipedream for one to think of getting north Korea to dismantle its nuclear weapons, and urging the need to explore ways for co-existing with north Korea, a possessor of nukes.
					
					 Doug Bandow, senior fellow at the Cato Institute and former special assistant to ex-President Ronald Reagan, in his commentary "North Korean crisis inches close to a boiling point. Now is a time to think over" said:
					
					 The U.S. had better reexamine its commitment to "security" in south Korea. In fact, the U.S. is left with no reason to continue to protect south Korea after the end of the Korean War.
					
					 The U.S. may opt to stop the presence of its forces and scrap the commitment to "security" in a phased manner.
					
					 What is important is that the withdrawal of the U.S. forces may write off the U.S. from the north Korea's list of attack targets.
					
					 The easiest way for clearing the U.S. of its concern about north Korea's missiles targeting the U.S. mainland is to get its hands off the Korean peninsula issue.
					
					 The U.S. should no longer be inveigled into the nuclear danger on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The director for state security planning of a research institute in Sidney contended that co-existence with north Korea, a possessor of long-range nuclear missiles, is the only way out for Washington at the moment until it swallows bitter pill.
					
					 Situation is undergoing a rapid change.
					
					 Time has now come for the U.S. to drop its hopeless hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. had better face up to the trend of history, make a switchover in its DPRK policy and thus fulfill its responsibility in ensuring peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 This will be beneficial for the U.S., too.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Wage Struggle for Release of Prisoners of Conscience
articles.content:
New Materials Proving Sexual Slavery Enforced by Japan Disclosed
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- A new document containing the list of Korean women, who had been drafted to Jinhua City of Zhejiang Province, China as sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army during the Pacific War, was made public on July 5, according to the south Korean Newsis.
					 Registered in the document made up in April 1944 are more than 100 Korean women in their twenties or thirties (names, ages and birth places). However, their jobs were not given and their residential addresses were the same as "comfort stations" of the Japanese army. 
					
					 Experts who studied the document declared that those women were sexual slaves for the Japanese army and that 10 "comfort stations" existed in the city alone at that time.
					
					 Meanwhile, a video on victims of the sexual slavery by the Japanese army which had been kept in U.S. National Archives was made public on July 5, according to the south Korean CBS.
					
					 The 18-second video clip made in September 1944 shows Korean women who had been drafted to the southern part of China by the Japanese imperialist aggressor troops as sexual slaves. Their images were, reportedly, just the same as the photos of the victims which had been already opened to public.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Un from Delegation of Federation of Korean Economic Workers in China
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Wage Struggle for Release of Prisoners of Conscience
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Students in south Korea have staged a struggle for the release of all prisoners of conscience in Seoul since July 4, according to the south Korean online paper Voice of People.
					 They declared that they would wage various social activities together with citizens to have all of prisoners of conscience released.

articles.title: Cambodian King, Great Queen Send Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Un from Delegation of Federation of Korean Economic Workers in China
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un received a letter from the delegation of the Federation of Korean Economic Workers in China on July 4.
					 Noting that members of the federation had their pleasant time in the homeland thanks to the warm loving care of Kim Jong Un, the letter said:
					
					 During our stay we renewed our firm faith that the final victory is in store for our country as it holds you in high esteem. We also witnessed for ourselves the hot wind for creating the Mallima Speed sweeping the whole country and all dreams and ideals of people coming true.
					
					 When we heard the news about the perfect success in the test-fire of intercontinental ballistic rocket Hwasong-14 under your guidance on July 4, in particular, we were so excited that we shouted hurrah for our great homeland with tears, recollecting the tireless efforts made by you.
					
					 All members of the federation will remain faithful to your leadership under whatever situation.
					
					 We will take the lead in the work to consolidate the General Federation of Koreans in China, a patriotic legacy left by the great leaders, into an overseas Koreans organization of you and in the patriotic movement for contributing to the national reunification and the building of a powerful nation.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Peru
articles.content:
Cambodian King, Great Queen Send Large Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy
 Pyongyang, July 8 (KCNA) -- Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni and Great Queen Norodom Monineath Sihanouk sent large floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Phnom Penh on July 5 to commemorate the 23rd anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Upon authorization of the king and the great queen, a delegation of the Cambodian Ministry of Royal Palace led by Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister for Royal Palace, laid the floral baskets at the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Algeria

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Palacio del Sol Kumsusan
Pyongyang, 8 de julio (ACNC) -- En ocasion del 23o aniversario del fallecimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito a la hora 0 del dia 8 el Palacio del Sol Kumsusan.
					El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un entro en el hall donde se encuentran las estatuas de pie del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					El jefe de la guardia de honor de las fuerzas terrestres, navales, aereas y antiaereas del EPC y del Ejercito Rojo Obrero-Campesino dio el parte de recepcion hacia las estatuas del Presidente y el Dirigente.
					
					Fue colocado ante las estatuas el cesto de flores en nombre del Maximo Dirigente.
					
					Y se deposito otro a nombre comun del CC del PTC, la Comision Militar Central del PTC y el Comite de Estado de la RPDC.
					
					Junto con los participantes, el Maximo Dirigente rindio sublime homenaje al Presidente y al Dirigente ante sus estatuas de pie.
					
					Tambien, les rindio homenaje al Presidente y el Dirigente en los salones de eternidad donde estan conservados sus cuerpos.
					
					En la ceremonia de homenaje participaron los funcionarios de los organismos del partido y las fuerzas armadas y los miembros que contribuyeron al exitoso lanzamiento del cohete balistico intercontinental.

articles.title: Periodicos coreanos publican editoriales por el dia de fallecimiento de Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Periodicos coreanos publican editoriales por el dia de fallecimiento de Kim Il Sung
Pyongyang, 8 de julio (ACNC) -- Los periodicos coreanos insertaron en sus ediciones de hoy los editoriales dedicados al aniversario 23 del fallecimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung.
					 El es el Sol del Juche, patriota sin par y padre eterno de la nacion quien acumulo hazanas inmortales ante la patria, el pueblo, la epoca y la revolucion con su original idea y teorias y gran capacidad ejecutiva de la revolucion, elogiaron los periodicos.
					
					  El diario Rodong Sinmun escribio que hay muchos politicos y grandes hombres de fama mundial, pero no hubo un lider tan destacado y un revolucionario tan grande como el Presidente quien dedico todo lo suyo a la lucha por verificar la independencia de las masas populares y preparo en su generacion las solidas bases para la prosperidad de la patria y la nacion.
					
					  Su idea revolucionaria es la guia directriz de la revolucion en que estan sistematizados integralmente el pensamiento filosofico centrado en el hombre, las teorias revolucionarias centradas en las masas populares y los metodos de direccion, destaco el rotativo y prosiguio:
					
					  La bandera de dar prioridad al autofortalecimiento, que enarbola hoy el pueblo coreano, esta basada en la idea revolucionaria del Presidente de que hay que cumplir la revolucion de cada pais con las fuerzas propias.
					
					  El hizo todo lo posible previendo el futuro lejano de la patria durante todo el periodo de su direccion sobre la revolucion.
					
					  Gracias a su sagrada vida patriotica, la RPDC emergio como invencible potencia ideo-politica, la militar sin rival y la juvenil prometedora.
					
					  Todos los patrimonios dejados como herencia por el Presidente Kim Il Sung devienen la piedra angular que garantiza la dignidad y prosperidad eternas de la nacion.
					
					  A su vez, el periodico Minju Joson exhorto a todos a luchar con dinamismo por realizar el deseo del Presidente sobre la construccion de una potencia socialista, unidos firmemente en torno al Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Minju Joson comenta conducta irreflexiva de autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Minju Joson comenta conducta irreflexiva de autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 8 de julio (ACNC) -- En un comentario individual divulgado hoy, el periodico Minju Joson condena a las autoridades surcoreanas que se portan de manera irreflexiva desde que se informaran del lanzamiento de prueba de ICBM en la RPDC, y prosigue:
					El mandatario surcoreano convoco apresuradamente la reunion plenaria del "Consejo de Seguridad Nacional" en que disparateo que "denuncia fuertemente la provocacion irresponsable del Norte de Corea".
					
					 Diciendo que "no esta en la circunstancia de responder solo con la declaracion", escenifico los aventureros ejercicios conjuntos de lanzamiento de misil balistico Sur de Corea-EE.UU. bajo la autorizacion de Trump.
					
					A su vez, los encargados de diplomacia y seguridad y los fulanos y menganos de los partidos en el poder y de la oposicion hablaron uno tras otro de la supuesta "violacion" y el "debate de la contramedida con la sociedad internacional".
					
					Entre tanto, los gangsteres de la capa militar surcoreana se atrevieron a ofender la dignidad de la Direccion Suprema de la RPDC con palabras conflictivas tales como "provocacion" y "destruccion total".
					
					Este comportamiento hace recordar al perro que ladra contra la luna.
					
					Puesto que el imperio americano esta desesperado para desatar la guerra nuclear en el espacio de existencia de la nacion coreana, nadie tiene derecho a cuestionar las justas medidas de autodefensa de la RPDC que consolida el escudo de justicia y el medio nuclear para defender el destino nacional y el maximo interes del pais y la paz y la seguridad del mundo.
					
					Ya paso para siempre el tiempo en que los titeres surcoreanos actuaban con petulancia bajo el amparo de su patron gringo.
					
					Ellos deben conocer bien que su rabia conflictiva de difamar la dignidad y el regimen de la connacional RPDC les sometera a las maldiciones y condenas de toda la nacion y al castigo divino.

articles.title: ?Que es lo que demanda la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana?: comentario de ACNC
articles.content:
?Que es lo que demanda la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana?: comentario de ACNC
Pyongyang, 8 de julio (ACNC) -- Ultimamente, los ex funcionarios de alto rango y los especialistas en el problema coreano de varios paises urgen a EE.UU. cambiar la anacronica politica de hostilidad contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					Tales voces que se escuchan en el interior de EE.UU. exigen a la administracion Trump que vea correctamente la cambiada estructura de la fuerza entre la RPDC y EE.UU. y cambie con audacia la politica.
					
					Eric Gomez, analista del Instituto Cato de EE.UU., expreso en su comentario como sigue:
					
					La politica de EE.UU. sobre Corea esta totalmente fracasada y la administracion Trump tendra que trazarla de nuevo desde el principio. Quiza la politica de "maxima presion" sea aceptada facilmente para los norteamericanos, pero casi no tiene posibilidad de cambiar la accion del Norte de Corea.
					
					Benette Ramberg, ex investigador de la politica perteneciente a la administracion Bush, senalo en su comentario que EE.UU. y el Sur de Corea deben reconocer la realidad del problema nuclear del Norte de Corea y buscar la manera de coexistir con este dejando su absurda ilusion de hacerle renunciar el arma nuclear.
					
					Doug Bandow, investigador superior del Instituto Cato, asesor especial del ex presidente estadounidense Ronald Reagan y experto de la politica exterior, publico un comentario que expone la siguiente opinion:
					
					EE.UU. debera reexaminar la promesa de "seguridad" dada al Sur de Corea.
					
					Despues del fin de la guerra coreana, EE.UU. no tiene ningun motivo para seguir protegiendo hasta ahora el Sur de Corea.
					
					EE.UU. podra tomar la opcion de anular por etapas el estacionamiento de sus tropas en suelo surcoreano y la promesa de "seguridad".
					
					Lo importante es que la retirada de tropas norteamericanas puede tachar el nombre de EE.UU. en la lista de blancos de ataque del Norte de Corea.
					
					De hecho, sacar la mano del problema de la Peninsula Coreana es el metodo mas sencillo para eliminar la preocupacion de EE.UU. por los misiles norcoreanos que apuntan el territorio norteamericano.
					
					No vale la pena que EE.UU. se hunda cada vez mas en el peligro nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					El director encargado del plan de seguridad internacional de un instituto en Sydney opino que para Washington, coexistir con el Norte de Corea, que tiene el misil nuclear de largo alcance, es el unico remedio hasta que trague la medicina amarga.
					
					La situacion se cambia.
					
					Ya es el tiempo en que EE.UU. deje su infructifera politica de hostilidad anti-RPDC.
					
					Al ver bien la corriente historica de hoy, EE.UU. debera cambiar su politica sobre Corea y cumplir con su responsabilidad asumida en el aseguramiento de la paz de la Peninsula Coreana, lo cual convendria a si mismo tambien.
